metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9458 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the Android kernel in the video driver there is a use after free due toa race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with noadditional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed forexploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9458` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-139.165
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-139.165
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-139.165
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1037.43
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1072.82
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1055.60
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1021.23~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1100-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1100.108
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1104-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1104.109
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-139.165').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1037.43').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1072.82').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.60').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1021.23~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1100.108').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1104.109').
